result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio La Boy Almodovar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Antonio La Boy Almodovar is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Antonio La Boy Almodovar was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court ordered defendant to pay a fine of $600.00 plus all mandatory costs, penalties, surcharges, including $50.00 ignition interlock surcharge. 
Pay all supervision fees. Provide DNA sample- pay surcharge. The Court ordered that all financial obligations be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes:
Seek and maintain employment.
Be given job and vocational training.
Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession and Voting.
No controlled substances (unless prescribed for mental health treatment) or alcohol.

Mental health assessment; treatment, if needed.
Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.

AODA assessment; treatment, if needed.
Urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant restricted to operation of vehicles equipped with an ignition interlock device for 2 years.
Court ordered AODA assessment and Driver's Safety Plan- be in compliance before license reinstated.

Defendant Antonio La Boy Almodovar in court with attorney Jason Canfield.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Branch 20 in trial.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Antonio La Boy Almodovar in court with attorney Jason Canfield.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel attempting to obtain records from both Illinois and Puerto Rico and requested additional time.  No objection by the State.  Case is to be set for plea and sentencing.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

15RM013283  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03/04/2015

Attorney Jason Canfield in court, defendant Antonio La Boy Almodovar not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. State turned over additional discovery to defense.  Parties request another scheduling conference.  Case adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defense motion for modification of bail heard and DENIED.

Defendant Antonio La Boy Almodovar in court with attorney Jason Canfield.  Defendant Antonio La Boy Almodovar in custody.  Ron Dague for Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by portable breathalyzer and SCRAM.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Antonio La Boy Almodovar in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Defendant Antonio La Boy Almodovar in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant pleads Not Guilty as to the Misdemeanor. Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
